question.content: International Yoga Day is celebrated on

solution.content: 21 June. The International Day of Yoga has been celebrated across the world annually since 2015, following its inception in the United Nations General Assembly in 2014. question.content: In India, the National Sports Day is celebrated on which date?

solution.content: 29th August. National Sports Day is celebrated to commemorate the Birth Anniversary of Hockey legend Major Dhyan Chand (he was the part of Olympic Hockey World cup team that won three consecutive Gold medals in 1928, 1932 and 1936 Summer olympics). 1 December - World Aids Day, 6 December Dr. Ambedkar Mahaparinirvan Divas, 14th November - Jawaharlal Nehru's Birthday/Childrens' Day.

question.content: Independence Day is celebrated every year in Pakistan on

solution.content: 14 August. India 15 August 1947. Independence Day of other Countries: Bangladesh - 26 March 1971, Sri Lanka 4 February 1948, Nepal - 21 December 1923, China - 1 October 1949, Myanmar 4 January 1948, America - 4 July 1776, Canada - 1 July 1867.

question.content: According to the Indian calendar, Vasanta Season falls in which months?

solution.content: Chaitra-Vaisakha. Seasons according to the Hindu Calendar: Grishma ritu Jyeshtha and Aashaadha, Varsha ritu - Shravana and Bhadrapada, Sharad ritu - Ashwin and Kartik, Shishir or Shita ritu Magha and Phalguna. Hindu months in chronological order: Chaitra, Vaishakh, Jyeshtha, Aashada, Shraavana, Bhadra, Ashwin, Kartik, Margashirsha, Pausha, Magha, Phalgun.

question.content: According to the Indian calendar, Hemanta season falls in which months?

solution.content: Margashirsa - Pausa. Other Seasons according to the Hindu Calendar: Basant ritu Chaitra and Vaisakha, Grishma ritu Jyeshtha and Aashaadha, Varsha ritu Shravana and Bhadrapada, Sharad ritu Ashwin and Kartik.

question.content: In which month of the Islamic calendar is 'Ramadan', a holy time when Muslims around the world fast and focus their attention on giving to charity (known as Zakat), observed?

solution.content: Ninth. Ramadan begins and ends with the appearance of the crescent moon. Islamic months- (1) Muharram, (2) Safar, (3) Rabi al-Awwal, (4) Rabi al-Thani, (5) Jumada al-Awwal, (6) Jumada al-Thani, (7) Rajab, (8) Shaban, (9) Ramadan, (10) Shawwal, (11) Dhu al-Qadah, (12) Dhu al-Hijjah (month of Hajj). question.content: On which day of the Hindu calendar is the festival of Holi celebrated?

solution.content: Falgun Poornima. The festival is celebrated for two days: First Day Holika Dahan or Chhoti Holi. Second Day Rangwali Holi, Dhulandi or Phagwah.

question.content: How many Indian states celebrate their formation on November 1 st?

solution.content: Seven. States formed on 1st November: Andhra Pradesh (1956), Karnataka (1956), Kerala (1956), Madhya Pradesh (1956), Haryana (1966), Punjab (1966), Chhattisgarh (2002). Two Union Territories also formed on this day: Puducherry (1954) and Lakshadweep (1956).

question.content: Engineer's Day in India is celebrated in the memory of

solution.content: Dr. M. Visvesvaraya. He was Chief Engineer of Mysore State (1909) and the 19th Dewan of Mysore (1912 to 1918). Books: "Reconstructing India" and "Planned Economy of India". Engineer's Day (15 September) in India is celebrated for their contribution. Awards Order of the Indian Empire (1911); Bharat Ratna (1955).

question.content: Every year, Halloween is celebrated on

solution.content: 31st October. A holiday widely observed particularly in the United States and Canada. 24th November: Thanksgiving Day (in the United States). 25th December: Christmas Day. 18th December - International Migrants Day. 1 December - World AIDS day.

solution.content: Muharram has a 10-day period when Muslims mourn the martyrdom of Hazrat Imam Hussain, son of Hazrat Ali and Grandson of Prophet Muhammad.

question.content: "Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas" is observed on the birth anniversary of

solution.content: Birsa Munda. Birsa himself declared that God had appointed him to save his people from trouble, free them from the slavery of dikus (outsiders). He led the Munda rebellion in modern-day Jharkhand and Bihar. The Union Cabinet has approved 15th November (in 2021) as Janjatiya Gaurav Divas.

question.content: International Tiger Day observed on_

solution.content: July 29th Celebrate with the aim of conserving tigers and saving their endangered species.

question.content: International Day for the preservation of the Ozone layer is observed on.

solution.content: September 16. The ozone layer (found in the stratosphere) is a thin part of Earth's atmosphere that absorbs almost all of the sun's harmful ultraviolet light. 18 September - World Bamboo Day, 21 September - International Day of Peace (UN), 26 September World Environmental Health Day, 10 September - World Suicide Prevention Day (WSPD).

question.content: In which month, Hiroshima Day is observed across the world?

solution.content: August. Hiroshima Day is observed on 6 August (Little Boy) to commemorate the atomic bombing of Hiroshima Japan in the year 1945 and 6 August (Fat Man) of Nagasaki, at the end of World War II (1939 -1945). World War I- 1914 to 1918. The atomic bomb is based on the principle of nuclear fission.

question.content: "World Refugee Day" is observed every year on

solution.content: 20th June. World Refugee Day 2023 Theme: "Whoever, Whatever, Whenever." First time: 2001. It is designated as an International Day by the UN (United Nations). It celebrates the strength and courage of people who have been forced to flee their home country to escape conflict or persecution.

question.content: Swami Vivekananda's death anniversary is observed on

solution.content: July 4. Swami Vivekananda was born on 12 January 1863. January 12 is observed as National Youth Day. Vivekananda Title Maharaja Ajit singh of Khetri. Established RamaKrishna Mission in 1897. He Introduced Indian philosophies of Vedanta and Yoga.

options.text: Yoga for the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals

answer: Yoga for the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals

solution.content: 24th December. On this day the Consumer Protection Act, 1986 had received the assent of the president. World Consumer Rights Day - 15 March.

question.content: When is National Handloom Day celebrated?

solution.content: 7th August (Celebrated Since 2015). National Handloom Day is celebrated to mark the beginning of Swadeshi Andolan on August 7, 1905. Aim To encourage indigenous industries including handloom weavers.

question.content: When is National Girl Child Day observed annually in India?

solution.content: 24 January. It was started by the Ministry of Women and Child Development and the Government of India in 2008. The purpose of the celebration is to spread awareness among people about all the inequalities faced by girls in Indian society.

question.content: When is the Hindi Diwas observed annually?

solution.content: 14 September (Celebrated Since 1953). On 14 September 1949, the Constituent Assembly accepted Hindi in the Devanagari script as the official language of India. World Hindi Day January 10.
